newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Datacraft sees S$40 mln boost from deal.
newsitem.headline: Datacraft sees S$40 mln boost from deal.

text.p: Communications and systems integrator Datacraft Asia Ltd said on Thursday its Asia sales could rise Singapore $40 million (US$28 million) over three years after signing a partnership deal with a U.S. technology firm.

"The sort of figure we're looking at from this deal is about S$40 million over a three-year period," Datacraft executive director Ron Cattell said after announcing a three-year marketing deal with Cascade Communications Corp.
Cattell told a news conference the deal would make Datacraft the "prime marketing channel in Asia" for Cascade's advance frame relay products.
Frame relays are used for high speed data services including Internet, multimedia and high definition video applications.
China is a big user of the technology and is using it for large swathes of its communications networks, said Cattell.
"It is the major provinces of China more than anywhere else that will be implanting this technology and where much of the market growth will come from," Cattell said.
"The next two years will really see a large uptake in the frame relay market," he added.
Datacraft would initially aim for a 20 percent share of the frame relay market in Asia and then seek to expand from there, Cattell said.

The frame relay market worldwide is estimated to be worth about US$1.6 billion with Cascade commanding a high proportion of that, including a 56 percent share of the frame relay market for Internet applications, Cattell said.
